turn.2: History of cricket in India from 1918–19 to 1945 This article describes the history of cricket in India from the 1918-19 season until the end of the Second World War in 1945.
turn.3: When did the raji trophy start
turn.4: The Ranji Trophy was launched as India's national championship following a meeting of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) in July 1934 and the competition began in the 1934-35 season.
turn.5: Why was it named after someone
turn.6: The trophy was donated by the Maharajah of Patiala but named after KS Ranjitsinhji ("Ranji"), even though he barely played any of his cricket in the country.
